00054 /**
00055  *  \file
00056  *  This file contains low-level radio driver code.
00057  *  This version is optimized for use with the "barebones" RF230bb driver,
00058  *  which communicates directly with the contiki core MAC layer.
00059  *  It is optimized for speed at the expense of generality.
00060  */
00061 #include "contiki-conf.h"
00062 #if DEBUGFLOWSIZE
00063 extern uint8_t debugflowsize,debugflow[DEBUGFLOWSIZE];
00064 #define DEBUGFLOW(c) if (debugflowsize<(DEBUGFLOWSIZE-1)) debugflow[debugflowsize++]=c
00065 #else
00066 #define DEBUGFLOW(c)
00067 #endif
00068 
00069 
00070 /*============================ INCLUDE =======================================*/
00071 #include <stdlib.h>
00072 
00073 #include "hal.h"
00074 
00075 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00076 #include <avr/io.h>
00077 #include "atmega128rfa1_registermap.h"
00078 #else
00079 #include "at86rf230_registermap.h"
00080 #endif
00081 
00082 /*============================ VARIABLES =====================================*/
00083 /** \brief This is a file internal variable that contains the 16 MSB of the
00084  *         system time.
00085  *
00086  *         The system time (32-bit) is the current time in microseconds. For the
00087  *         AVR microcontroller implementation this is solved by using a 16-bit
00088  *         timer (Timer1) with a clock frequency of 1MHz. The hal_system_time is
00089  *         incremented when the 16-bit timer overflows, representing the 16 MSB.
00090  *         The timer value it self (TCNT1) is then the 16 LSB.
00091  *
00092  *  \see hal_get_system_time
00093  */
00094 static uint16_t hal_system_time = 0;
00095 volatile extern signed char rf230_last_rssi;
00096 
00097 //static uint8_t volatile hal_bat_low_flag;
00098 //static uint8_t volatile hal_pll_lock_flag;
00099 
00100 /*============================ CALLBACKS =====================================*/
00101 
00102 /** \brief This function is called when a rx_start interrupt is signaled.
00103  *
00104  *         If this function pointer is set to something else than NULL, it will
00105  *         be called when a RX_START event is signaled. The function takes two
00106  *         parameters: timestamp in IEEE 802.15.4 symbols (16 us resolution) and
00107  *         frame length. The event handler will be called in the interrupt domain,
00108  *         so the function must be kept short and not be blocking! Otherwise the
00109  *         system performance will be greatly degraded.
00110  *
00111  *  \see hal_set_rx_start_event_handler
00112  */
00113 //static hal_rx_start_isr_event_handler_t rx_start_callback;
00114 
00115 /** \brief This function is called when a trx_end interrupt is signaled.
00116  *
00117  *         If this function pointer is set to something else than NULL, it will
00118  *         be called when a TRX_END event is signaled. The function takes one
00119  *         parameter: timestamp in IEEE 802.15.4 symbols (16 us resolution).
00120  *         The event handler will be called in the interrupt domain,
00121  *         so the function must not block!
00122  *
00123  *  \see hal_set_trx_end_event_handler
00124  */
00125 //static hal_trx_end_isr_event_handler_t trx_end_callback;
00126 
00127 /*============================ IMPLEMENTATION ================================*/
00128 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00129 //#include <avr/io.h>
00130 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00131 /* AVR1281 with internal RF231 radio */
00132 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN() 
00133 //#define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(to_write) (SPDR = (to_write))
00134 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT()
00135 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ() (SPDR)
00136 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE()
00137 #if 0
00138 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(to_write) (      \
00139                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(to_write),   \
00140                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT(),            \
00141                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ() )
00142 #endif
00143 #elif defined(__AVR__)
00144 /*
00145  * AVR with hardware SPI tranfers (TODO: move to hw spi hal for avr cpu)
00146  */
00147 #include <avr/io.h>
00148 #include <avr/interrupt.h>
00149 
00150 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN() { \
00151   HAL_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();    \
00152   HAL_SS_LOW(); /* Start the SPI transaction by pulling the Slave Select low. */
00153 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(to_write) (SPDR = (to_write))
00154 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT() ({while ((SPSR & (1 << SPIF)) == 0) {;}}) /* gcc extension, alternative inline function */
00155 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ() (SPDR)
00156 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE() \
00157     HAL_SS_HIGH(); /* End the transaction by pulling the Slave Select High. */ \
00158     HAL_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION(); \
00159     }
00160 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(to_write) (      \
00161                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(to_write),   \
00162                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT(),            \
00163                                     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ() )
00164 
00165 #else /* __AVR__ */
00166 /*
00167  * Other SPI architecture (parts to core, parts to m16c6Xp 
00168  */
00169 #include "contiki-mulle.h" // MULLE_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION
00170 
00171 // Software SPI transfers
00172 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN() { uint8_t spiTemp; \
00173   HAL_ENTER_CRITICAL_REGION();    \
00174   HAL_SS_LOW(); /* Start the SPI transaction by pulling the Slave Select low. */
00175 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(to_write) (spiTemp = spiWrite(to_write))
00176 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT()  ({0;})
00177 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ() (spiTemp)
00178 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE() \
00179     HAL_SS_HIGH(); /* End the transaction by pulling the Slave Select High. */ \
00180     HAL_LEAVE_CRITICAL_REGION(); \
00181     }
00182 #define HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(to_write) (spiTemp = spiWrite(to_write))
00183 
00184 inline uint8_t spiWrite(uint8_t byte)
00185 {
00186     uint8_t data = 0;
00187     uint8_t mask = 0x80;
00188     do
00189     {
00190         if( (byte & mask) != 0 )
00191             HAL_PORT_MOSI |= (1 << HAL_MOSI_PIN); //call MOSI.set();
00192         else
00193             HAL_PORT_MOSI &= ~(1 << HAL_MOSI_PIN); //call MOSI.clr();
00194 
00195         if( (HAL_PORT_MISO & (1 << HAL_MISO_PIN)) > 0) //call MISO.get() )
00196             data |= mask;
00197 
00198         HAL_PORT_SCK &= ~(1 << HAL_SCK_PIN); //call SCLK.clr();
00199         HAL_PORT_SCK |= (1 << HAL_SCK_PIN); //call SCLK.set();
00200     } while( (mask >>= 1) != 0 );
00201     return data;
00202 }
00203 
00204 #endif  /* !__AVR__ */

00206 /** \brief  This function initializes the Hardware Abstraction Layer.
00207  */
00208 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00209 //#define HAL_RF230_ISR() ISR(RADIO_VECT)
00210 #define HAL_TIME_ISR()  ISR(TIMER1_OVF_vect)
00211 #define HAL_TICK_UPCNT() (TCNT1)
00212 void
00213 hal_init(void)
00214 {
00215     /*Reset variables used in file.*/
00216     hal_system_time = 0;
00217  //   TCCR1B = HAL_TCCR1B_CONFIG;       /* Set clock prescaler */
00218  //   TIFR1 |= (1 << ICF1);             /* Clear Input Capture Flag. */
00219  //   HAL_ENABLE_OVERFLOW_INTERRUPT(); /* Enable Timer1 overflow interrupt. */
00220     hal_enable_trx_interrupt();    /* Enable interrupts from the radio transceiver. */
00221 }
00222 
00223 #elif defined(__AVR__)
00224 #define HAL_RF230_ISR() ISR(RADIO_VECT)
00225 #define HAL_TIME_ISR()  ISR(TIMER1_OVF_vect)
00226 #define HAL_TICK_UPCNT() (TCNT1)
00227 void
00228 hal_init(void)
00229 {
00230     /*Reset variables used in file.*/
00231     hal_system_time = 0;
00232 //  hal_reset_flags();
00233 
00234     /*IO Specific Initialization - sleep and reset pins. */
00235     DDR_SLP_TR |= (1 << SLP_TR); /* Enable SLP_TR as output. */
00236     DDR_RST    |= (1 << RST);    /* Enable RST as output. */
00237 
00238     /*SPI Specific Initialization.*/
00239     /* Set SS, CLK and MOSI as output. */
00240     HAL_DDR_SPI  |= (1 << HAL_DD_SS) | (1 << HAL_DD_SCK) | (1 << HAL_DD_MOSI);
00241     HAL_PORT_SPI |= (1 << HAL_DD_SS) | (1 << HAL_DD_SCK); /* Set SS and CLK high */
00242     /* Run SPI at max speed */
00243     SPCR         = (1 << SPE) | (1 << MSTR); /* Enable SPI module and master operation. */
00244     SPSR         = (1 << SPI2X); /* Enable doubled SPI speed in master mode. */
00245 
00246     /*TIMER1 Specific Initialization.*/
00247     TCCR1B = HAL_TCCR1B_CONFIG;       /* Set clock prescaler */
00248     TIFR1 |= (1 << ICF1);             /* Clear Input Capture Flag. */
00249     HAL_ENABLE_OVERFLOW_INTERRUPT(); /* Enable Timer1 overflow interrupt. */
00250     hal_enable_trx_interrupt();    /* Enable interrupts from the radio transceiver. */
00251 }
00252 
00253 #else /* __AVR__ */
00254 
00255 #define HAL_RF230_ISR() M16C_INTERRUPT(M16C_INT1)
00256 #define HAL_TIME_ISR()  M16C_INTERRUPT(M16C_TMRB4)
00257 #define HAL_TICK_UPCNT() (0xFFFF-TB4) // TB4 counts down so we need to convert it to upcounting
00258 
00259 void
00260 hal_init(void)
00261 {
00262     /*Reset variables used in file.*/
00263     hal_system_time = 0;
00264 //  hal_reset_flags();
00265 
00266     /*IO Specific Initialization - sleep and reset pins. */
00267     DDR_SLP_TR |= (1 << SLP_TR); /* Enable SLP_TR as output. */
00268     DDR_RST    |= (1 << RST);    /* Enable RST as output. */
00269 
00270     /*SPI Specific Initialization.*/
00271     /* Set SS, CLK and MOSI as output. */
00272     HAL_DDR_SS  |= (1 << HAL_SS_PIN);
00273     HAL_DDR_SCK  |= (1 << HAL_SCK_PIN);
00274     HAL_DDR_MOSI  |= (1 << HAL_MOSI_PIN);
00275     HAL_DDR_MISO  &= ~(1 << HAL_MISO_PIN);
00276 
00277     /* Set SS */
00278     HAL_PORT_SS |= (1 << HAL_SS_PIN); // HAL_SS_HIGH()
00279     HAL_PORT_SCK &= ~(1 << HAL_SCK_PIN); // SCLK.clr()
00280 
00281     /*TIMER Specific Initialization.*/
00282     // Init count source (Timer B3)
00283     TB3 = ((16*10) - 1); // 16 us ticks
00284     TB3MR.BYTE = 0b00000000; // Timer mode, F1
00285     TBSR.BIT.TB3S = 1; // Start Timer B3
00286 
00287     TB4 = 0xFFFF; //
00288     TB4MR.BYTE = 0b10000001; // Counter mode, count TB3
00289     TBSR.BIT.TB4S = 1; // Start Timer B4
00290     INT1IC.BIT.POL = 1; // Select rising edge
00291     HAL_ENABLE_OVERFLOW_INTERRUPT(); /* Enable Timer overflow interrupt. */
00292     hal_enable_trx_interrupt();    /* Enable interrupts from the radio transceiver. */
00293 }
00294 #endif  /* !__AVR__ */

00431 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00432 /* Hack for internal radio registers. hal_register_read and hal_register_write are
00433    handled through defines, but the preprocesser can't parse a macro containing
00434    another #define with multiple arguments, e.g. using
00435    #define hal_subregister_read( address, mask, position ) (address&mask)>>position
00436    #define SR_TRX_STATUS         TRX_STATUS, 0x1f, 0
00437    the following only sees 1 argument to the macro
00438    return hal_subregister_read(SR_TRX_STATUS);
00439    
00440    Possible fix is through two defines:
00441    #define x_hal_subregister_read(x) hal_subregister_read(x);
00442    #define hal_subregister_read( address, mask, position ) (address&mask)>>position
00443    but the subregister defines in atmega128rfa1_registermap.h are currently set up without
00444    the _SFR_MEM8 attribute, for use by hal_subregister_write.
00445    
00446  */
00447 uint8_t
00448 hal_subregister_read(uint16_t address, uint8_t mask, uint8_t position)
00449 {
00450     return (_SFR_MEM8(address)&mask)>>position;
00451 }
00452 void
00453 hal_subregister_write(uint16_t address, uint8_t mask, uint8_t position,
00454                             uint8_t value)
00455 {
00456  cli();
00457     uint8_t register_value = _SFR_MEM8(address);
00458     register_value &= ~mask;
00459     value <<= position;
00460     value &= mask;
00461     value |= register_value;
00462     _SFR_MEM8(address) = value;
00463  sei();
00464 }
00465 
00466 #else /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
00467 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00468 /** \brief  This function reads data from one of the radio transceiver's registers.
00469  *
00470  *  \param  address Register address to read from. See datasheet for register
00471  *                  map.
00472  *
00473  *  \see Look at the at86rf230_registermap.h file for register address definitions.
00474  *
00475  *  \returns The actual value of the read register.
00476  */
00477 uint8_t
00478 hal_register_read(uint8_t address)
00479 {
00480     uint8_t register_value;
00481     /* Add the register read command to the register address. */
00482     /* Address should be < 0x2f so no need to mask */
00483 //  address &= 0x3f;
00484     address |= 0x80;
00485 
00486     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN();
00487 
00488     /*Send Register address and read register content.*/
00489     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(address);
00490     register_value = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(0);
00491 
00492     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE();
00493 
00494     return register_value;
00495 }
00496 
00497 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00498 /** \brief  This function writes a new value to one of the radio transceiver's
00499  *          registers.
00500  *
00501  *  \see Look at the at86rf230_registermap.h file for register address definitions.
00502  *
00503  *  \param  address Address of register to write.
00504  *  \param  value   Value to write.
00505  */
00506 void
00507 hal_register_write(uint8_t address, uint8_t value)
00508 {
00509     /* Add the Register Write (short mode) command to the address. */
00510     address = 0xc0 | address;
00511 
00512     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN();
00513 
00514     /*Send Register address and write register content.*/
00515     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(address);
00516     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(value);
00517 
00518     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE();
00519 }
00520 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00521 /** \brief  This function reads the value of a specific subregister.
00522  *
00523  *  \see Look at the at86rf230_registermap.h file for register and subregister
00524  *       definitions.
00525  *
00526  *  \param  address  Main register's address.
00527  *  \param  mask  Bit mask of the subregister.
00528  *  \param  position   Bit position of the subregister
00529  *  \retval Value of the read subregister.
00530  */
00531 uint8_t
00532 hal_subregister_read(uint8_t address, uint8_t mask, uint8_t position)
00533 {
00534     /* Read current register value and mask out subregister. */
00535     uint8_t register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00536     register_value &= mask;
00537     register_value >>= position; /* Align subregister value. */
00538 
00539     return register_value;
00540 }
00541 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00542 /** \brief  This function writes a new value to one of the radio transceiver's
00543  *          subregisters.
00544  *
00545  *  \see Look at the at86rf230_registermap.h file for register and subregister
00546  *       definitions.
00547  *
00548  *  \param  address  Main register's address.
00549  *  \param  mask  Bit mask of the subregister.
00550  *  \param  position  Bit position of the subregister
00551  *  \param  value  Value to write into the subregister.
00552  */
00553 void
00554 hal_subregister_write(uint8_t address, uint8_t mask, uint8_t position,
00555                             uint8_t value)
00556 {
00557     /* Read current register value and mask area outside the subregister. */
00558     volatile uint8_t register_value = hal_register_read(address);
00559     register_value &= ~mask;
00560 
00561     /* Start preparing the new subregister value. shift in place and mask. */
00562     value <<= position;
00563     value &= mask;
00564 
00565     value |= register_value; /* Set the new subregister value. */
00566 
00567     /* Write the modified register value. */
00568     hal_register_write(address, value);
00569 }
00570 #endif /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
00571 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00572 /** \brief  This function will upload a frame from the radio transceiver's frame
00573  *          buffer.
00574  *
00575  *          If the frame currently available in the radio transceiver's frame buffer
00576  *          is out of the defined bounds. Then the frame length, lqi value and crc
00577  *          be set to zero. This is done to indicate an error.
00578  *          This version is optimized for use with contiki RF230BB driver.
00579  *          The callback routine and CRC are left out for speed in reading the rx buffer.
00580  *          Any delays here can lead to overwrites by the next packet!
00581  *
00582  *  \param  rx_frame    Pointer to the data structure where the frame is stored.
00583  *  \param  rx_callback Pointer to callback function for receiving one byte at a time.
00584  */
00585 void
00586 //hal_frame_read(hal_rx_frame_t *rx_frame, rx_callback_t rx_callback)
00587 hal_frame_read(hal_rx_frame_t *rx_frame)
00588 {
00589 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00590

00599         *rx_data++ = _SFR_MEM8(rx_buffer++);
00600 
00601     } while (--frame_length > 0);
00602

00604     rx_frame->lqi = *rx_buffer;
00605     if (1) {

00647 /* RF230 does crc in hardware, doing the checksum here ensures the rx buffer has not been overwritten by the next packet */

00681 
00682 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00683 /** \brief  This function will download a frame to the radio transceiver's frame
00684  *          buffer.
00685  *
00686  *  \param  write_buffer    Pointer to data that is to be written to frame buffer.
00687  *  \param  length          Length of data. The maximum length is 127 bytes.
00688  */
00689 void
00690 hal_frame_write(uint8_t *write_buffer, uint8_t length)
00691 {
00692 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__)
00693     uint8_t *tx_buffer;
00694     tx_buffer=(uint8_t *)0x180;  //start of fifo in i/o space
00695     /* Write frame length, including the two byte checksum */
00696     /* The top bit of the length field shall be set to 0 for IEEE 802.15.4 compliant frames */
00697     /* It should already be clear, so bypassing the masking is sanity check of the uip stack */
00698 //  length &= 0x7f;
00699     _SFR_MEM8(tx_buffer++) = length;
00700     
00701     /* Download to the Frame Buffer.
00702      * When the FCS is autogenerated there is no need to transfer the last two bytes
00703      * since they will be overwritten.
00704      */
00705 #if !RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
00706     length -= 2;
00707 #endif
00708     do  _SFR_MEM8(tx_buffer++)= *write_buffer++; while (--length);
00709 
00710 #else /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
00711     /* Optionally truncate length to maximum frame length.
00712      * Not doing this is a fast way to know when the application needs fixing!
00713      */
00714 //  length &= 0x7f; 
00715 
00716     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN();
00717 
00718     /* Send Frame Transmit (long mode) command and frame length */
00719     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(0x60);
00720     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(length);
00721 
00722     /* Download to the Frame Buffer.
00723      * When the FCS is autogenerated there is no need to transfer the last two bytes
00724      * since they will be overwritten.
00725      */
00726 #if !RF230_CONF_CHECKSUM
00727     length -= 2;
00728 #endif
00729     do HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(*write_buffer++); while (--length);
00730 
00731     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE();
00732 #endif /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
00733 }
00734

00741  * \param length Length of the read burst
00742  * \param data Pointer to buffer where data is stored.

00753

00823 /* The atmega128rfa1 has individual interrupts for the integrated radio'
00824  * Whichever are enabled by the RF230 driver must be present even if not used!
00825  */
00826 /* Received packet interrupt */
00827 ISR(TRX24_RX_END_vect)
00828 {
00829 /* Get the rssi from ED if extended mode */
00830 #if RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00831         rf230_last_rssi=hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL);
00832 #endif
00833 
00834 /* Buffer the frame and call rf230_interrupt to schedule poll for rf230 receive process */
00835 /* Is a ram buffer available? */
00836         if (rxframe[rxframe_tail].length) {DEBUGFLOW('0');} else /*DEBUGFLOW('1')*/;
00837 
00838 #ifdef RF230_MIN_RX_POWER                
00839 /* Discard packets weaker than the minimum if defined. This is for testing miniature meshes */
00840 /* This does not prevent an autoack. TODO:rfa1 radio can be set up to not autoack weak packets */
00841         if (rf230_last_rssi >= RF230_MIN_RX_POWER) {
00842 #else
00843         if (1) {
00844 #endif
00845 //              DEBUGFLOW('2');
00846                 hal_frame_read(&rxframe[rxframe_tail]);
00847                 rxframe_tail++;if (rxframe_tail >= RF230_CONF_RX_BUFFERS) rxframe_tail=0;
00848                 rf230_interrupt();
00849         }
00850 }
00851 /* Preamble detected, starting frame reception */
00852 ISR(TRX24_RX_START_vect)
00853 {
00854 //      DEBUGFLOW('3');
00855 /* Save RSSI for this packet if not in extended mode, scaling to 1dB resolution */
00856 #if !RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00857     rf230_last_rssi = 3 * hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);
00858 #endif
00859 
00860 }
00861 
00862 /* PLL has locked, either from a transition out of TRX_OFF or a channel change while on */
00863 ISR(TRX24_PLL_LOCK_vect)
00864 {
00865 //      DEBUGFLOW('4');
00866 }
00867 
00868 /* PLL has unexpectedly unlocked */
00869 ISR(TRX24_PLL_UNLOCK_vect)
00870 {
00871         DEBUGFLOW('5');
00872 }
00873 /* Flag is set by the following interrupts */
00874 extern volatile uint8_t rf230_interruptwait;
00875 
00876 /* Wake has finished */
00877 ISR(TRX24_AWAKE_vect)
00878 {
00879 //      DEBUGFLOW('6');
00880         rf230_interruptwait=0;
00881 }
00882 
00883 /* Transmission has ended */
00884 ISR(TRX24_TX_END_vect)
00885 {
00886 //      DEBUGFLOW('7');
00887         rf230_interruptwait=0;
00888 }
00889

00891 extern volatile uint8_t rf230_pending;
00892 ISR(TRX24_XAH_AMI_vect)
00893 {
00894 //      DEBUGFLOW('8');
00895         rf230_pending=1;
00896 }
00897 
00898 /* CCAED measurement has completed */
00899 ISR(TRX24_CCA_ED_DONE_vect)
00900 {

00902         rf230_interruptwait=0;

00905 #else /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
00906 /* Separate RF230 has a single radio interrupt and the source must be read from the IRQ_STATUS register */
00907 HAL_RF230_ISR()
00908 {
00909     /*The following code reads the current system time. This is done by first
00910       reading the hal_system_time and then adding the 16 LSB directly from the
00911       hardware counter.
00912      */
00913 //    uint32_t isr_timestamp = hal_system_time;
00914 //    isr_timestamp <<= 16;
00915 //    isr_timestamp |= HAL_TICK_UPCNT(); // TODO: what if this wraps after reading hal_system_time?
00916 
00917     volatile uint8_t state;
00918     uint8_t interrupt_source; /* used after HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN/CLOSE block */
00919 
00920     INTERRUPTDEBUG(1);
00921 
00922     
00923     /* Using SPI bus from ISR is generally a bad idea... */
00924     /* Note: all IRQ are not always automatically disabled when running in ISR */
00925     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN();
00926 
00927     /*Read Interrupt source.*/
00928     /*Send Register address and read register content.*/
00929     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WRITE(0x80 | RG_IRQ_STATUS);
00930 
00931     /* This is the second part of the convertion of system time to a 16 us time
00932        base. The division is moved here so we can spend less time waiting for SPI
00933        data.
00934      */
00935 //   isr_timestamp /= HAL_US_PER_SYMBOL; /* Divide so that we get time in 16us resolution. */
00936 //   isr_timestamp &= HAL_SYMBOL_MASK;
00937 
00938     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_WAIT(); /* AFTER possible interleaved processing */
00939 
00940 #if 0 //dak
00941     interrupt_source = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_READ(); /* The interrupt variable is used as a dummy read. */
00942 
00943     interrupt_source = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(interrupt_source);
00944 #else
00945     interrupt_source = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(0);
00946 #endif
00947     HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE();
00948 
00949     /*Handle the incomming interrupt. Prioritized.*/
00950     if ((interrupt_source & HAL_RX_START_MASK)){
00951            INTERRUPTDEBUG(10);
00952     /* Save RSSI for this packet if not in extended mode, scaling to 1dB resolution */
00953 #if !RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00954 #if 0  // 3-clock shift and add is faster on machines with no hardware multiply
00955        // While the compiler should use similar code for multiply by 3 there may be a bug with -Os in avr-gcc that calls the general subroutine
00956         rf230_last_rssi = hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);
00957         rf230_last_rssi = (rf230_last_rssi <<1)  + rf230_last_rssi;
00958 #else  // Faster with 1-clock multiply. Raven and Jackdaw have 2-clock multiply so same speed while saving 2 bytes of program memory
00959         rf230_last_rssi = 3 * hal_subregister_read(SR_RSSI);
00960 #endif
00961 #endif
00962 //       if(rx_start_callback != NULL){
00963 //            /* Read Frame length and call rx_start callback. */
00964 //            HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_OPEN();
00965 //            uint8_t frame_length = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(0x20);
00966 //            frame_length = HAL_SPI_TRANSFER(frame_length);
00967 
00968 //            HAL_SPI_TRANSFER_CLOSE();
00969 
00970 //            rx_start_callback(isr_timestamp, frame_length);
00971 //       }
00972     } else if (interrupt_source & HAL_TRX_END_MASK){
00973            INTERRUPTDEBUG(11);              
00974 //         if(trx_end_callback != NULL){
00975 //       trx_end_callback(isr_timestamp);
00976 //     }
00977         
00978        state = hal_subregister_read(SR_TRX_STATUS);
00979        if((state == BUSY_RX_AACK) || (state == RX_ON) || (state == BUSY_RX) || (state == RX_AACK_ON)){
00980        /* Received packet interrupt */ 
00981        /* Buffer the frame and call rf230_interrupt to schedule poll for rf230 receive process */
00982 //         if (rxframe.length) break;                   //toss packet if last one not processed yet
00983          if (rxframe[rxframe_tail].length) INTERRUPTDEBUG(42); else INTERRUPTDEBUG(12);
00984  
00985 #ifdef RF230_MIN_RX_POWER                
00986        /* Discard packets weaker than the minimum if defined. This is for testing miniature meshes.*/
00987        /* Save the rssi for printing in the main loop */
00988 #if RF230_CONF_AUTOACK
00989  //       rf230_last_rssi=hal_subregister_read(SR_ED_LEVEL);
00990         rf230_last_rssi=hal_register_read(RG_PHY_ED_LEVEL);
00991 #endif
00992         if (rf230_last_rssi >= RF230_MIN_RX_POWER) {       
00993 #endif
00994          hal_frame_read(&rxframe[rxframe_tail]);
00995          rxframe_tail++;if (rxframe_tail >= RF230_CONF_RX_BUFFERS) rxframe_tail=0;
00996          rf230_interrupt();
00997 //       trx_end_callback(isr_timestamp);
00998 #ifdef RF230_MIN_RX_POWER
00999         }
01000 #endif
01001 
01002        }
01003               
01004     } else if (interrupt_source & HAL_TRX_UR_MASK){
01005         INTERRUPTDEBUG(13);
01006         ;
01007     } else if (interrupt_source & HAL_PLL_UNLOCK_MASK){
01008         INTERRUPTDEBUG(14);
01009             ;
01010     } else if (interrupt_source & HAL_PLL_LOCK_MASK){
01011         INTERRUPTDEBUG(15);
01012 //      hal_pll_lock_flag++;
01013         ;
01014     } else if (interrupt_source & HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK){
01015         /*  Disable BAT_LOW interrupt to prevent endless interrupts. The interrupt */
01016         /*  will continously be asserted while the supply voltage is less than the */
01017         /*  user-defined voltage threshold. */
01018         uint8_t trx_isr_mask = hal_register_read(RG_IRQ_MASK);
01019         trx_isr_mask &= ~HAL_BAT_LOW_MASK;
01020         hal_register_write(RG_IRQ_MASK, trx_isr_mask);
01021 //      hal_bat_low_flag++; /* Increment BAT_LOW flag. */
01022         INTERRUPTDEBUG(16);
01023         ;
01024      } else {
01025         INTERRUPTDEBUG(99);
01026             ;
01027     }
01028 }
01029 #endif /* defined(__AVR_ATmega128RFA1__) */
